text: John Mitchell Baker Pottinger known as Jackie (1913-1979) was a boxer who competed for Wales. ==Boxing career== Pottinger won a bronze medal in the flyweight division at the 1934 British Empire Games in London. He lost to Georgie Coyle of New York in the New York Golden Gloves tournament during 1935. ==Personal life== He was a manufacturer by trade and lived at 97 Ferry Road, Grangetown, Cardiff in 1935. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1979 deaths Category:Welsh male boxers Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for Wales Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Boxers at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Flyweight boxers
title: Jackie Pottinger
